education.field_of_study: Information Studies: track Business Information Systems

awards.title: Winning team 'Entrepreneurship Challenge'
awards.description:
The aim of the Certificate Program is to enhance academic knowledge and build a bridge towards the more practical aspects of entrepreneurship. The program concludes with a final challenge. Students break up into teams to tackle real-life case studies from local entrepreneurs and compete for the title of Winning Team.
Our assignment was to find alternative ways of revenue for a local Oil/Fuel Distributor. In our end presentation we advised the entrepreneur to make better use of Social Media, integrate online and offline sales and build better customer loyalty with his clients through Product Presentation Events and New Customer Promotions.
awards.issuer: Tilburg University, Brabant Center of Entrepreneurship

projects.title: The Road Symposium 2016
projects.description:
This year, the 10th edition of The Road Symposium will be organized. The Road is the largest entrepreneurship symposium in Tilburg and generally draws more than 400 visitors, including university students, (student) entrepreneurs and staff from different organizations.
The Symposium Committee of the Academic Business Club consists of carefully selected students from different study organizations, all are highly motivated, have excellent study results and have prior experience with organizing (large) events for students.

projects.title: Participant More Sustainable Life @ Home Project
projects.description: In this cross-departmental project we researched the sustainable project offering of IKEA. We took a customer perspective and selected several products that can contribute to more sustainable life at home. All project members elaborately tested these projects during an extended period. During the project meetings we reflected in the sustainable solutions we found and how we could increase awareness for these products in our market area. The project ended with a project report that was shared with the management of IKEA Nederland.

projects.title: The Road Symposium 2014
projects.description:
On the 14th of April 2014, the 8th edition of The Road Symposium was organized, themed The Road to the Future: Social Entrepreneurship. The Road is the largest entrepreneurship symposium in Tilburg and drew over 300 visitors, including university students, (student) entrepreneurs and staff from different organizations.
The Symposium Committee of the Academic Business Club consists of specially selected students from different organizations, all are highly motivated, have excellent study results and have prior experience with organizing (large) events for students. The committee arranged the keynote speakers (Prof. Gert van Dijk: TiasNimbas Business School and Nyenrode Business Universiteit, Marieke Hart: Thuisafgehaald.nl, Hanna Verboom: Get it Done, Blue Economy), chairman of the day (Karin Bruers), conference location (Midi Tilburg) and hosted and organized the event.

projects.title: The International Marketing Expedition 2013 (Singapore & Maleisië)
projects.description:
The International Marketing Expedition (TIME) is een initiatief van studievereniging Asset | Marketing, in samenwerking met Tilburg University. Het doel van TIME is het verrichten van internationaal marktonderzoek voor Nederlandse bedrijven in een interessante buitenlandse markt, met in 2013 Singapore en Maleisië als bestemming. De onderzoeken worden uitgevoerd door tien getalenteerde studenten die affiniteit hebben met marketing en speciaal voor dit project zijn geselecteerd. 
De werkzaamheden van de deelnemers bestaan uit het benaderen van bedrijven, deze overtuigen om in het project te investeren, een onderzoeksvoorstel schrijven, internationaal marktonderzoek doen in het buitenland en vervolgens een rapport met de resultaten uitbrengen en presenteren.

profile_positions.description:
The Business Navigator (BNOM) function’s purpose is to navigate the growth of the IKEA Store and steer the business towards a sustained long term profitability. The BNOM needs to analyse what moves the performance in the different dimensions of the business and consequently recommend improvements in close cooperation with the different stakeholders in the organisation. These improvements concern both short term actions as also new tactics in our strategic planning.

In the Management Team the BNOM supports in setting commercial, financial and operational targets and then securing adequate reporting and actively look for more efficient working methods.

Also responsible for the specialists in Staff Planning & Timekeeping, Safety & Security, Facility Management, Cost Controlling and Product Recovery & Quality.
profile_positions.title: Business Navigation & Operations Manager

profile_positions.description: Involved in a study on the local labor market to support the implementation of a new recruitment policy at IKEA Nederland to improve the percentage of successful hires and the Recruitment Experience.
profile_positions.title: HR Business Analyst

profile_positions.description: This position briefly holds all activities within the Customer Relations department of IKEA (which are the same for any IKEA store in the world). Sub-categories: Reception Desk (welcome business visitors and reception related administration work, Customer Delivery Registration, Customer Service Desk, Check Out (including Express Check Out), Children's Day Care and Customer Goods Pick Up (on an external location). Every co-worker is trained for each sub-category according to their abilities, work experience and motivation.
profile_positions.title: Allround Customer Relations Co-worker

profile_positions.description:
Young people have many untapped talents. It is my goal to help them develop those talents and engage them beyond their current studies and interests. I found that many young people want to learn how to be digitally creative and thats where I focus on. 
 
I offered training courses in Adobe Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator, Wordpress, Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel) and film editing.
profile_positions.title: Independent Business Owner

profile_positions.description: Working on multiple marketing and communications projects as a freelancer. Including: web design, DTP, CRM and CMS.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Communications Officer (interim)

profile_positions.description:
As a staff member worked in the organization of large events such as the Opening of the academic year, the Open Day and the Master's Information Evening. For each event I coordinated several projects and was responsible for the leadership to the University students working during the events. 

In my work I was constantly involved in the improvement and innovation of events, constantly asking feedback from visitors and students.
profile_positions.title: Marketing & Communication - Event support

company.name: Hogeschool van Amsterdam | Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences

profile_positions.description: Thesis research project for my Master Information Studies: Business Information Systems at the University of Amsterdam. The goal of the research is to find out how the knowledge gap between education and practice in the field of cyber security can be closed.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Intern

profile_positions.description: Supporting a consultant in researching client satisfaction of Dutch insurance companies, doing administrative work and process improvement of work routines.
profile_positions.title: Project Support

profile_positions.description: The Intercontinental Travel Committee (ITC) organizes a two-week intercontinental trip for 20 Tilburg University students to Buenos Aires (Argentina) and Santiago (Chile). The committee organizes different company visits, cultural activities and all  transport related to the travel. The ITC committee is ons of the most time intensive committee at the study association.
profile_positions.title: Chairman Intercontinental Travel Committee

profile_positions.description:
Co-organizing early pre-university marketing activities (Profielkeuzevoorlichting 3-vwo, Kick-off Profielwerkstuk), responsibility of planning, preparing and supervising the activities. Furthermore, verbal and written communication play an important role in the job, i.e. preparing and doing presentations, i.e. elementary web editing and text editing. I support Communication Officers from the department Events & Campaigns that are responsible for the marketing of the Bachelor and Master programs at Tilburg University and its Research.
★ In the last two months I worked as a staff member and I was responsible for co-managing customer relations and organizing activities for visiting secondary schools (50-150 pupils).
profile_positions.title: Education & Research Marketing (Events & Campaigns) Student Employee

profile_positions.description: Inform and advice higher secondary education pupils about the choices they have to make regarding education before starting their professional career. Being a representative of Tilburg University is an important part of this job, e.g. when informing pupils about the bachelor study Organisation Studies. Giving presentations and workshops throughout The Netherlands. Being a host during the Bachelor's and Master's Open Days.
profile_positions.title: BSc Organisation Studies Representative

profile_positions.description: The Academic Business Club is an association that encourages entrepreneurship with students. I have a general responsibility of Board duties and Coordinator of the largest Symposium on Entrepreneurship in Tilburg (April 2014).
profile_positions.title: Board Member

profile_positions.description: Chairing and preparing meetings for the committee. Organizing Info sessions (training and coaching sessions) on Adobe Photoshop and Adobe InDesign for committee members. Supervising online and offline design and publishing projects (printed publications).
profile_positions.title: Chairman Promotion Committee

profile_positions.description: General editing of articles in the FIRST Quarterly Magazine. Designing the magazine in Adobe InDesign and Photoshop and setting general design and publishing standards. Interviewing business representatives, students and university staff.
profile_positions.title: Senior Editor & Chief Designer of the FIRST Quarterly Magazine

volunteer_experiences.description: Human rights are taken for granted in the Netherlands, In other parts of the world, this is not that case. I am collecting funds and I support the Area coordinator in my community to help protect human rights of people accross the globe.
